title: 19 February Webinar: Why Libraries Need Legal Guarantees in the Digital Age
content:
On 19 February 2026, I will be participating in Knowledge Rights 21‚Äôs webinar ‚ÄúEnabling Libraries, Guaranteeing Rights: A Legal Checklist for the Digital Age‚Äù. The event marks the launch of an important new publication: ‚ÄúSafeguard Access, Empower Europe ‚Äì An Action Plan to Let Libraries be Libraries.‚Äù

I‚Äôm glad to be part of this conversation, because the issues at stake go to the very heart of what we are trying to protect through the Our Future Memory campaign: the ability of libraries to preserve, lend, and provide access to knowledge in the digital age ‚Äî in the public interest.
creator: Beatrice Murch

title: Internet Archive Europe at FOSDEM 2026: Powered by Community (and Stickers)
content:
FOSDEM 2026 reminded us, once again, why this community is so special.

Over the weekend in Brussels, our Internet Archive Europe stand became a lively meeting point filled with conversations, questions, laughter, and a steady flow of familiar and new faces. Representing Internet Archive Europe on site were Beatrice Murch, Program Manager at Internet Archive Europe; Jeff Klein, Senior Software Engineer working on ADS/Vault at the Internet Archive; Tommi Marmo, DWeb Community Engagement Lead; Jeroen Baten, IAE Volunteer Extraordinaire, open source developer, and AngryNerd podcaster; and the wonderful last minute assistance provided by volunteer Beth McCarthy
creator: Beatrice Murch

content:
This Valentine‚Äôs Day, Internet Archive Europe invites you to celebrate love ‚Äî not just romantic love, but love for free software, open technologies, and the communities that care for them.

On Saturday, 14 February, we‚Äôre opening our doors in Amsterdam for a special afternoon event combining a children‚Äôs book reading, thoughtful conversation, and a shared commitment to a more open digital future: ‚ÄúAda & Zangemann‚Äù book reading & I ‚ô• Free Software Day.

A story about curiosity, courage, and open technology
